label: 鎮魂
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: （alt., tamashizume) a ritual to recall the spirit of the dead or to pacify the spirits of the dead. According to the Yōrō Code, on the eve of the harvest festival or Niinamesai 新嘗祭 in the eleventh lunar month, such a ritual was conducted in the royal palace to pray for long life and prosperity for the tennō and the royal family.　[養老令]
